intro: Papaver medium, commonly known as the Iceland poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Arctic regions. It is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine and subarctic habitats. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
